channel.title: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]
channel.description:
[center][b]RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures - SOURCE[/b][/center]
Check it out! It has a bunch of features including dynamic signatures (stat sigs), displaying the stats on a webpage, and much more. :)
Test: http://goons.freepgs.com/FUN/rs_stats_grabber.php Source: http://goons.freepgs.com/php_scripts.php?p=RuneScape%20Statistics%20and%20Stat%20Signatures
This script now works perfectly for both PHP 4.x.x and PHP 5.x.x thanks to teh spede for telling me how to get the file_get_contents() to work on 4.x.x and php.net for the microtime_float() function!
Comments please. :D
~Ron

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

When it gets the username, immediately swap the %20 for an underscore. Shoot%20%20%20Here only works as Shoot___Here.

item.source: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]

item.title: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Heh, beat yea MastrChief! Woo… lol.

This is a small beta version that I can’t find any bugs with.

http://goons.freepgs.com/FUN/rs_stats_pic_extra.php?user=x x sniper x&trans=true&skill=ranged

http://goons.freepgs.com/FUN/rs_stats_pic_extra.php?user=x x sniper x&skill=5

You can put in a number for the skill or the exact skill name. You can also set the transparency on. So it will make the background transparent. You can also set the r, g, b value of the color and the w, and h.

Read full topic

item.title: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:69, topic:122074”]Wow teh spade! That’s wonderful! I’ll give it a try and put it into the next version. If this works, thank you very much! I replied to your PM by the way.

And that’s a cool idea MastrChief. teh spade, told me about it in a PM. I’ll make that a feature when I can. :)[br][size=1]Posted on: July 30, 2007, 11:56:10 AM[/size][hr]I changed the code so it will not detect the PHP version, and then execute what it should. I tried it on pwnds’ webhost and it worked. He’s using PHP 4.x.x. Credited teh spade and I also noticed one small bug when using this code on PHP 4.x.x webhosts.

The time it takes to generate the stats went into the negatives because I was using a PHP 5.x.x function. PHP.net/microtime helped me out.[/quote]

Yay I did something good =P

EDIT: My name is teh spede not teh spade

Read full topic
item.source: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]

item.title: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Wow teh spade! That’s wonderful! I’ll give it a try and put it into the next version. If this works, thank you very much! I replied to your PM by the way.

And that’s a cool idea MastrChief. teh spade, told me about it in a PM. I’ll make that a feature when I can. :)[br][size=1]Posted on: July 30, 2007, 11:56:10 AM[/size][hr]I changed the code so it will not detect the PHP version, and then execute what it should. I tried it on pwnds’ webhost and it worked. He’s using PHP 4.x.x. Credited teh spade and I also noticed one small bug when using this code on PHP 4.x.x webhosts.

The time it takes to generate the stats went into the negatives because I was using a PHP 5.x.x function. PHP.net/microtime helped me out.

Read full topic
item.source: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]

item.title: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

I got these scripts to work on a v4.x.x by changing this line:

  $rs = file_get_contents("http://hiscore.runescape.com/hiscorepersonal.ws?user1=$user_real", FALSE, NULL);

To this:

   $rs = file_get_contents("http://hiscore.runescape.com/hiscorepersonal.ws?user1=$user_real");

In the file rs_stats_get.php
=)

Read full topic
item.source: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]

item.title: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

EDIT:

Well, I got it working, sort of. The only problem I’m having is it won’t cut off at the end of the skill like I keep telling it to. I’ll see if I can get this done tonight, if not, then maybe the next day, hopefully…

item.title: RS Stats Grabber & RS Stat Signatures [SOURCE]
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Naw it didn’t work, thanks any way man. I used 2 or 3 of those functions but they spouted errors that I couldn’t fix because I’m not familiar with those functions. Anyway, even if it did work, the max for the buffer like sppt said is 65535 and that doesn’t show enough characters. Any higher value than that and it will just show weird results.

hmmm…
